column4: hi all, i have just being changing some of the settings for  services and i modified gdm so it did not start on boot, however i now want to change it back
could someone tell me what the default setting is
ie. for each run level should it be start/stop/ignore and the priority
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=89491&highlight=bootlog
great thread, thanks, do you know what the priority should be?
uhm just read the thread, i believe it explained well what's needed and what's not so necessary
when in doubt just shout in here what's "such and such" supposed to be and etc...
the only service that i changed was gdm, in the article it says when the service should be running but not at which priority, i've set it to 50 at the moment for run levels 2,3,4,5
i suppose the question i'm asking is, could someone look at what settings they have for gdm
fantastic, cheers
minus the first 3
np
what did you use to get that info, a terminal command?
sysvconfig
should be in repos with the same name
great, i'll check it out
np
i believe it was mentioned in that thread i gave you too
sysv-rc-conf?
oh there's another?
should function similarly though
well i'll restart and see how things go, if it doesn't work i'll have to call it a night cos its late with me, thanks for the help
